data.title: At least three killed in suspected terror attack in Israel
data.description: At least three people were killed and four injured in a suspected terror attack in the central Israeli city of Elad, according to Israel's emergency response services.

data.title: Two killed, many injured in Tel Aviv shooting
data.description: Two people were killed and more than a dozen others wounded in a shooting at a bar in a busy area of Tel Aviv late on Thursday, Israeli officials said.

data.title: Law enforcement officials warn of potential violence in DC and nationwide in wake of Supreme Court draft opinion
data.description: Law enforcement officials in Washington, DC, are bracing for potential security risks posed by reactions to the leaked draft Supreme Court majority opinion that would strike down Roe v. Wade.

data.title: Golf on safari: animals roam the greens at Africa's only PGA-accredited course
data.description: At Africa's only PGA accredited golf course, zebras, giraffes and monkeys walk freely around the grounds.

data.title: Vicky White was once a trusted corrections officer, but officials say there was a side she hid. Here's what we know about her
data.description: Vicky White, a former assistant director of corrections for Lauderdale County in Alabama, was once considered to be the perfect employee and a person whom her colleagues could trust.

data.title: 5 things to know for May 6: Ukraine, Roe v. Wade, Covid-19, Wildfires, Immigration
data.description: Here's what else you need to know to Get Up to Speed and On with Your Day.

data.title: Children get long Covid, too, and it can show up in unexpected ways
data.description: November 10 is a day Kim Ford remembers too well. It was the day last year when her 9-year-old son, Jack, was scheduled to get his Covid-19 vaccine at the school clinic. They were excited that he'd finally have some protection, but on November 9, he had the sniffles.

data.title: Western officials have warned that Russia could formally declare war on Ukraine, paving the way for Putin to step up his campaign
Serena Williams: 'I should have been at like 30 or 32' grand slam singles titles
data.description: Widely considered to be the GOAT of women's tennis, 23-time grand slam champion Serena Williams says she's still aiming to beat Margaret Court's record of 24.

data.title: Luhansk official: 'Our guys are holding on'
NYPD investigates assault on rabbi in latest anti-Semitic incident in New York City
data.description: The New York Police Department's Hate Crime Task Force is investigating an assault on a Long Island rabbi by an attacker who allegedly made anti-Semitic remarks and referenced Nazis, police said Saturday.

data.title: A small plane crashed into a backyard in Houston. All four people on board walked away
data.description: A small plane carrying four people crashed into a backyard in Houston on Friday, and all four people on board walked away.

data.title: Russia's war in Ukraine
data.description: The Ukrainian government said that "all women, children and elderly" were evacuated from Mariupol's Azovstal plant as Zelensky and G7 leaders are set to meet Sunday. Follow here for live news updates.

data.title: Ukrainian tennis players live 'parallel lives' at the Billie Jean King Cup
data.description: Wearing a shirt decorated with the Ukrainian flag in the shape of a heart, Lyudmyla Kichenok practiced her serve with teammate Dayana Yastremska in an empty arena under the watchful eyes of their captain Olga Savchuk on Thursday.

data.title: This Ohio congressional candidate repeatedly shared pro-QAnon material
data.description: J.R. Majewski, the Air Force veteran who won the GOP primary for Ohio's new 9th Congressional District, was a January 6 rally participant and has repeatedly shared pro-QAnon material -- including a video showing him painting his lawn to say Trump 2020 with "Q" replacing the zeros.

data.title: Australian Open: Rafael Nadal wins record-breaking 21st grand slam after beating Daniil Medvedev in epic final
data.description: Australian Open: Rafael Nadal wins record-breaking 21st grand slam after beating Daniil Medvedev in epic final

data.title: 2 killed in plane crash near Golden Gate Bridge, sheriff's office says
data.description: A plane crash northwest of San Francisco's Golden Gate Bridge on Friday afternoon killed two people, the Marin County Sheriff's Office said in a news release.

data.title: Russia's war in Ukraine
data.description: Ukraine has accused Russia of dropping a bomb on a school in the Luhansk region where 90 people were taking shelter. Dozens of people are feared dead. Follow here for live updates.

data.title: India and Pakistan heatwave is 'testing the limits of human survivability'
data.description: Temperatures in parts of India and Pakistan have reached record levels, putting the lives of millions at risk as the effects of the climate crisis are felt across the subcontinent.

data.title: Foreign business urges China to change course on Covid
data.description: Groups representing Western businesses in China are urging Beijing to relax its approach to Covid, saying harsh lockdowns are damaging earnings and investment and forcing a growing number of companies to consider shifting operations out of the world's second biggest economy.

data.title: Watch Putin's speech as Russia commemorates Victory Day
data.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke at an annual military parade in Red Square, Moscow, as the country celebrated its Victory Day, commemorating the defeat of Nazi Germany in 1945.

data.title: Rivian's stock plunges on report that Ford is selling shares
data.description: Rivian's stock plunged 13% Monday as early investors jumped at their first opportunity to sell their shares — including, reportedly, Ford.
